description: This Java class represents a Macro processor that handles conditional macro expressions such as #if, #elseif, and #else. It evaluates expressions against substitutions to determine which content to include based on macro conditions, and it provides mechanisms for validation and string representation.

classes.name: Macro
classes.description: A container for multiple MacroExpression objects representing conditional macro logic, with methods to add expressions, evaluate conditions, and validate macro structure.

methods.name: addExpression
methods.description: Adds a MacroExpression to the macro container, ensuring only one primary (#if) and one catch-all (#else) are present, throwing exceptions if constraints are violated.

methods.name: evaluateMacro
methods.description: Evaluates the macro expressions against a given Substitution to determine which content should be included based on macro conditions.

methods.name: getSpanStart
methods.description: Returns the starting position of the macro in the original buffer.

methods.name: setSpanStart
methods.description: Sets the starting position of the macro in the original buffer.

methods.name: getSpanEnd
methods.description: Returns the ending position of the macro in the original buffer.

methods.name: setSpanEnd
methods.description: Sets the ending position of the macro in the original buffer.

methods.name: validateMacro
methods.description: Validates the macro structure to ensure it contains at least a main #if and spans are properly set.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the macro, including all #if, #elseif, and #else sections, along with the #end marker.
